channel.title: Ademia [A clean delta][No TPC][NIO]
channel.description:
[b]I'm still working on 317beta, its just been put on hold until this is done.[/b]
[b][size=18pt]Also, I'm lare96[/size][/b]
[b][size=18pt]THIS IS RELEASED HERE:[/size][/b] http://uppit.com/exz36j1bq8l4/Ademia.zip
If it gets removed and you need a mirror just tell me!
[b]REVISION: 135[/b]
[u][b]Intro[/b][/u] Well I was supposed to release a clean delta a numerous amount of times but something always got in the way whether it was school or something with the project or whatever.
I think I'm doing this more for me than for the people using this, mainly because I feel I should have done and released something like this so long ago.
By now most of you are probably thinking - "Here we go again, another one of his delta cleaning projects that he won't finish". To be honest, I'm pretty confident I'll finish it (mainly because of the great progress I already made), but I'm not promising anything.
[u][b]Purpose[/b][/u] [b]If you want a base full of content with customs and a 500+ gameframe, this server isn't for you.[/b] [b]If you want an extremely bare base to develop from, do not use this, use Hyperion or Runesource.[/b]
This base is going to be something between those two statements I made above. Just enough content to be able to develop off of from with sufficient knowledge, but not too much content. So I guess you can say this is a content-less server.
Yes this will be clean, and everything and every class will be documented.
To help you guys out I'll release skills for this base and such (if people decide to use).
I'll also be re-releasing this in different revisions which will contain improvements to this server overall.
[u][b]Development[/b][/u] Been going great actually, there was one [b]huge[/b] problem but that was an easy fix.
[code](December 4, 2012) REV: 30 - Deleted useless classes (anti-lag and other stupid crap) - Packaged - Started cleaning - crash patched - now uses task scheduler rather than a while loop for more accurate processing - added Listener class - completely cleaned out the server class, looks great - holy shit got so much done - better item equipment handling - repackaged again for more neatness
(December 5, 2012) REV: 35 - started on object system - position system - location systems
(December 6, 2012) REV: 48 - w00000t fixed a huge error that could have caused a huge problem - finished an updating system - flooding system (extremely basic and shitty) - finished obejct system - teleporting - garbage collection - cleaned a bit
(December 7, 2012) REV: 65 - cleaned a bit - fixed error regarding player updating - UID System - edited the update system, works flawlessly now - added the 'flawless switching' every next vagina on mopar is advertising about - packets are now loaded through an array
(December 8, 2012) REV: 85 - worked on packets - walk to actions system, its beautiful - better item requirements - cleaned
(December 9, 2012) REV: 92 - moved server -> client packets in a different class - improved freezing methods - improved teleblocking methods - better wilderness and multicombat checks - cleaned - better update flags - started on concepts folder, could be useful to developers
(December 10, 2012) REV: 96 - requirements are now handled in a cfg file, really easy to use, better than anything ive ever seen implemented into a winterlove - cleaned
(December 11, 2012) REV: 98 - made a skill class
(December 12, 2012) REV: 98 - rest day
(December 13, 2012) REV: 102 - fully removed combat
(December 14, 2012) REV: 110 - cleaned - added an appearance class to handle player appearance values - created a player data class to handle the loading and saving of a player - Client class milestone! 100kb! Lots more to clean. - cleaned even more - Another milestone!!! 35kb!! almost done client class cleaning - removed trading
(December 15, 2012) REV: 120 - weapon animations class - removed shitty flooding system - update flags - energy regenerating - documentation
(December 16, 2012) REV: 122 - thread per client removed (having trouble with an error)[/code]
As you can see, [s]I've only been working on this a few days, and[/s] I have accomplished much.
My favorite thing I wrote so far was probably the update sytem I made, I'm not gonna say or show much about it, you can wait for the release of this :D
[u][b]Pictures[/b][/u] [IMG]http://i891.photobucket.com/albums/ac113/zezimo52/ademia1.png[/img] [IMG]http://i891.photobucket.com/albums/ac113/zezimo52/ademia4.png[/img] [IMG]http://i891.photobucket.com/albums/ac113/zezimo52/ademia6.png[/img] [IMG]http://i891.photobucket.com/albums/ac113/zezimo52/ademia10.png[/img] [IMG]http://i891.photobucket.com/albums/ac113/zezimo52/ademia11.png[/img]
[b]Server Update System[/b] [IMG]http://i891.photobucket.com/albums/ac113/zezimo52/ademia9.png[/img]
[b]UID System[/b] [IMG]http://i891.photobucket.com/albums/ac113/zezimo52/ademia5.png[/img]
[b]Anti-massing systems using attributes[/b] [IMG]http://i891.photobucket.com/albums/ac113/zezimo52/ademia3.png[/img]
[b]Player rights[/b] [IMG]http://i891.photobucket.com/albums/ac113/zezimo52/ademia7.png[/img] [IMG]http://i891.photobucket.com/albums/ac113/zezimo52/ademia8.png[/img]
[b]Teleporting re-done in one method, doesn't touch the processing code[/b] [IMG]http://i891.photobucket.com/albums/ac113/zezimo52/teleport.gif[/img]
[b]Clean Client class[/b] [IMG]http://i891.photobucket.com/albums/ac113/zezimo52/lolyo_zps53e238a5.png[/img]
[u][b]Credits[/b][/u] Delta winterLove blakeman8192 Graham Whackatre assholerule Soulcist

item.title: Ademia [A clean delta][No TPC][NIO]
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

Soulcist:

I don’t agree at all with how the server updates (the messages in the shoutbox), and the way the player-rights are done (unless you’re going to be the only one to have access to this and therefore know) but it’s still something new.

The server updates is kind of half assed I’ll admit, but I like the player rights. It’s just easier. If you wanted to use the playerRights integer model you can always use the ‘ordinal()’ method. Thanks for the base

Read full topic

it did not work. I added Gateway.remove("" +player.connectedFrom+ "");
in actionsbuttons.java at case 9154, no changes.[/quote]
Make sure that the connectedFrom field is equal to the hosts name. If you don’t know how to do this, send me your LoginProtocol/Client/ActionButtons classes through pm

I should have also added an Entity system before I released. If you want me to do this, just I might make a tutorial.

@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“Mario PvP, post:88, topic:471630”]Bug report.

Whenever you relog more then 3 times you get rejected.

Engine: Rejected 127.0.0.1:19517[/quote]
Probably the flooding system, make sure your connections are being removed from the hashmap upon logout! Should be “Gateway.remove(host);” or something like that.

item.title: Ademia [A clean delta][No TPC][NIO]
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

  1. I’m not a moron, keep your comments to yourself if you think otherwise.
  2. I’m not talking about “clean” as in code / content removed, I’m talking about “clean” as in cleaned, revised code. Yes some is redone, and some could be better.
  3. I also stated that I’ve barely looked at the base before posting about resource leaks.

There was no need to be a jack ass and reply hostility. You could have simply asked: “AtomicInt_, what do you mean ‘far from clean’ I’ve spent weeks cleaning the base before this release?” And I would have happily given you my opinionated input.

Edit: also, I can understand where your annoyance comes from, but I never said anything other than it’s far from clean. Which again is my opinion, which shouldn’t matter in the slightest, I’m nobody.

Read full topic

item.title: Ademia [A clean delta][No TPC][NIO]
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:83, topic:471630”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=589274.msg4198000#msg4198000 date=1357786284]
See, this is why nobody likes to help anyone on Mopar. If someone disagrees with what a User says, then they automatically resort to calling them a name, or insulting them. Everyone has different views on Programming, especially when it comes to Java.
[/quote]
it was just moronic of him to say it wasn’t close to being clean when i spent weeks cleaning it

  1. its unfinished
  2. everyone else ive talked too said its clean enough

its annoying as fuck because i even took the time out to document everything. You don’t understand.[/quote]

It’s not “clean”. It may be “clean enough” and it may be “cleaner”.
If a car is dirty, and I clean the inside, that’s “clean enough” for me to comfortably drive it. It’s also “cleaner” than before I cleaned it. However, because I hadn’t cleaned the outside, it’s not “clean”.

Read full topic

item.title: Ademia [A clean delta][No TPC][NIO]
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:79, topic:471630”]word of advice, never use [tt]@SuppressWarnings(“resource”)[/tt], either:

A.) Close the stream or
B.) Use the try-with-resources statement which automatically closes the stream when the statement has finished.

try (Stream stream = new Stream(...)) { ... }

I haven’t really gotten into the internals yet, but from what I’ve seen so far, it’s still far from clean.[/quote]
its unfinished. And don’t be a moron. Its not ‘far’ from clean. Compare this to an average delta. or as a matter of fact send me a delta you think is cleaner than this

Read full topic

item.title: Ademia [A clean delta][No TPC][NIO]
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

word of advice, never use [tt]@SuppressWarnings(“resource”)[/tt], either:

A.) Close the stream or
B.) Use the try-with-resources statement which automatically closes the stream when the statement has finished.

try (Stream stream = new Stream(...)) { ... }

I haven’t really gotten into the internals yet, but from what I’ve seen so far, it’s still far from clean.

Read full topic
